oai_dc:dc.dc:description: KNOXVILLE WOMAN FOR SENATOR Present indications are that Senator Shields will be appointed to the supreme court bench in which event, the office of United States Senator would be vacant, and the vacancy would have to be filled by the governor. A movement was started yesterday in Knoxville to have Gov. Taylor appoint Mrs. L. Crozier French to succeed Sen. Shields. Mrs French has contributed several articles to the HERALD on political and educational matters, which makes this appointment of local interest. She has been prominent in many reforms in state laws, and is held in high esteem by Knoxville people, where she has spent many years of her life. Should Mrs. French be appointed, she would be the first woman to ever serve in the United States Senate. Mrs. Felton who was recently appointed in Georgia to fill out the unexpired term of Sen. Tom Watson will likely never take her seat in the senate, but will simply be given the title of senator with the salary for the few months of the unex
